summary: Create and save your own custom spells during normal play by combining almost 40 different magic effects.  With the ability to vary the duration, the target type, the amount of damage, the level of targets affected, and more for each magic effect, there are literally thousands of possible combinations.
descriptionHtml:
[center][url=http://www.skyrimgems.com][img]http://i.imgur.com/hXQSy.png[/img][/url][/center]
[heading][color=yellow][u]Spell Crafting For Skyrim[/u][/color][/heading]
Create and save your own custom spells during normal play by combining over 40 different magic effects. With the ability to vary the duration, the target type, the amount of damage, the level of targets affected, and more for each magic effect, there are literally [b]thousands[/b] of possible combinations.

Each crafted spell can have up to five magic effect. You can combine Destruction effects with Illusion to make a Fury spell which also damages its target. Or combine Restoration effects with Alteration to make a spell to increase a follower's armor and fortify their one-handed and block skills. Or add a Conjured Bound Bow to an archery fortification and a muffle effect to craft a perfect assassin's spell.

The only limit is your imagination!

Featured in Skylight #11. Thanks Gopher, very cool!

(28.09.2015) Featured in Brodual's Skyrim Mod series. Thanks, Brodual!

[youtube]1JS3cr7gGrw[/youtube]    [youtube]xoTQHZE5Fbg[/youtube]

[youtube]iedRX3IavHc[/youtube]    [youtube]Lis5N_iN3uQ[/youtube]

** Requires SKSE 1.7.3 (or greater) and SkyUI 4.1 (or greater, to use the MCM menu). Revised versions (>=0.9.6.1) also require Dawnguard and Dragonborn.
[b]
[heading][color=yellow][u]SpellCrafting for Skyrim 1.0.1 Update[color=rgb(255, 255, 255)] [color=#f4f4f4](23.08.2016[/color][/color][color=#f4f4f4])[/color][/u][/color][/heading]

Major bugfix edition - thanks to several users' comments, I have managed to track a bug which might have plagued many more - the refreshing of menus might have happened in wrong order; now it should be fixed. The same goes for Inspect Spell power. Thanks to SurferOtter, oldmanshoe and Sevalecan for reporting these issues.

[/b]If you'd like to read older updates (from 0.9.5 to 1.0.0), read [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/editarticles/?aid=50548&id=33598]Older Archived Updates[/url] article or a Changelog.

[heading][color=yellow][u]Perkus Maximus patch 0.0.9 Update[/u][/color] (25.07.2016)[/heading]

Walls have been added to correct formlists; the patch is now open for translations as well.
Read [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/articles/50457/?]Perma Patch article[/url] to learn more. Unless some bugs come up, I'm gonna move to SkyRe, which I have neglected way too long.

[heading][color=yellow][u]Spell Crafting portable altar - Campfire Addon 0.0.1 Update[/u][/color] (25.07.2016)[/heading]
Nothing changed, but the entire ESP is now open for translation.

[heading][color=yellow][u]How It Works[/u][/color][/heading]
An [u]Altar of Spells[/u] has been added to the Hall of Attainment in Winterhold. Activating the Altar will allow you to pick from the list of magic effects you have mastered and combine them into new spells. You can have up to 25 custom spells at a time. Once a spell has been created you will be able to name your new spell and have it appear in your spell menu with that name.

Magic effects are mastered by learning [u]Cantrips[/u]. There is a Cantrip for each magic effect; learning the Cantrip for a magic effect will allow you to use that effect when creating new spells. Cantrips can be learned in two ways. You can purchase Cantrip Tomes from Melrin Amborsius, the keeper of the Altar of Spells -- a new vendor who has been added to the Winterhold staff. Or you can learn Cantrips during normal play by casting spells from the original game which use a similar magic effect. Each time you cast Sparks or Chain Lightning, there is a chance you will learn the Shock Damage Cantrip if you don't already know it. However, not all magic effects can be learned in this way -- so be sure to see what Melrin is selling from time to time.

A complete library describing each magic effect, all of its possible variations, and their associated casting costs and perks has been provided. Check the shelves around the Altar of Spells for these Tomes.

[heading][color=yellow][u]The Spell Crafting Journal[/u][/color][/heading]
The first time you use the Altar of Spells, be sure to pick up your Spell Crafting Journal. The Journal will let you review the Cantrips you have currently mastered, examine the details of the spells you have crafted, and forget custom spells. Reading the Journal will activate menus to guide you through each activity. The ability to forget a crafted spell lets you get rid of spells that you aren't happy with, or create more powerful versions of your favorite spells when your Magicka level increases.

[heading][color=yellow][u]New Magic Effects[/u][/color][/heading]
Spell Crafting for Skyrim adds several new magic effects not available as spells in vanilla Skyrim.

[color=orange]Absorption[/color] -- Craft spells which absorb health, magicka, or stamina from a target and add it to your own.

[color=orange]Damage Attribute[/color] -- Craft spells that directly damage the health, magicka or stamina of a target. Requires less magicka than Absorption, Fire, Frost, or Shock damage.

[color=orange]Weakness[/color] -- Craft spells which give the target a 25%, 50%, or 100% weakness to Fire, Frost, Shock, Poison, or Magic.

[color=orange]Conjure Dragon Priest[/color] -- Craft a spell to conjure a Dragon Priest for 30 seconds, 60 seconds, 120 seconds, or permanently.

[color=orange]Slow[/color] -- Craft spells that slow a target's rate of movement.

[color=orange]Detect Life[/color] and [color=orange]Detect Undead[/color] -- New versions have been added that do not require a constant magicka drain.

[color=orange]Resistance[/color] -- Craft spells that provide 15%, 25%, or 35% resistance to Fire, Frost, Shock, Poison, or Magic for 30, 60, or 120 seconds.

[color=orange]Fortification[/color] -- Craft spells that provide 15%, 25%, or 35% fortification to Marksman, Block, Light Armor, Heavy Armor, One Handed, Two Handed, Health, Stamina, Magicka (0.9.6.2) Alchemy, Speechcraft, Enchanting, Lockpicking, Smithing, Sneak, or Carry Weight. The fortification lasts for 30, 60, or 120 seconds.

[color=orange]Cure Disease[/color] -- Acts like a Cure Disease Potion without the need to carry potions.

[color=orange]Magic Ward[/color] -- Create a barrier to absorb damage or effects from spells without a constant magicka drain.

[color=orange]Weapons Ward[/color] -- Create a barrier to block physical damage without a constant magicka drain.

[color=orange]Summon Gargoyle [/color]-- (0.9.6.2) Previously available only to Vampire Lords, now they can be summoned like a regular creature.

[color=orange]Ethereal [/color]-- Previously available only by using a shout, now they can be crafted into a costly Alteration spell.

[heading][color=yellow][u]All Magic Effects[/u][/color][/heading]
The complete list of magic effects that can be mastered and combined is:

Destruction:
[list]
[*]Absorb Health, Magicka, or Stamina
[*]Damage Health, Magicka, or Stamina
[*]Fire Damage
[*]Frost Damage
[*]Shock Damage
[*]Weakness to Fire, Frost, Shock, Poison, or Magic
[*]Flame Cloak
[*]Frost Cloak
[*]Lightning Cloak
[*]Fire/Frost/Shock Rune (0.9.6.2)
[*]Fire/Frost/Shock Wall (1.0.0)

[/list]
Illusion:
[list]
[*]Calm
[*]Courage
[*]Fear
[*]Fury
[*]Invisibility
[*]Muffle
[*]Frenzy Rune (0.9.8)
[/list]
Conjuration:
[list]
[*]Conjure Familiar
[*]Conjure Atronach
[*]Conjure Dremora Lord
[*]Conjure Dragon Priest
[*]Conjure Skeleton
[*]Conjure Draugr
[*]Bound Sword
[*]Bound Battle Axe
[*]Bound Bow
[*]Banish Daedra
[*]Command Daedra
[*]Soul Trap
[*]Reanimate
[*]Summon Gargoyle (0.9.6.2)
[*]Summon Mistman (0.9.6.2)
[*]Summon Boneman (0.9.6.2)
[*]Summon Wrathman (0.9.6.2)
[/list]
Alteration:
[list]
[*]Armor
[*]Become Ethereal
[*]Detect Life
[*]Detect Undead
[*]Slow
[*]Paralyze
[*]Waterbreathing
[/list]
Restoration:
[list]
[*]Resist Fire, Frost, Shock, Poison, or Magic
[*]Heal, Heal over time (0.9.9)
[*]Fortify skills & Atrributes
[*]Cure Disease
[*]Turn Undead
[*]Magic Ward
[*]Weapons Ward
[*]Sun Damage (0.9.6.2)
[*]Sun Cloak (0.9.6.2)
[*]Heal Undead (0.9.6.2)
[*]Poison Rune (0.9.8)
[*]Restore Stamina (0.9.9)
[/list]
[heading][color=yellow][u]MCM Configuration Menu[/u][/color][/heading]
Through the MCM Configuration menu you can:

[list]
[*]Adjust the time interval between magic effects
[*]Adjust the speed at which Cantrips are learned by casting spells
[*]Adjust the number of Rune spells which can be active at the same time
[*]Enable or disable Cantrip learning
[*]Deactivate or reactivate the entire mod
[*]Enable or disable all Cantrips in a school of magic with one click
[*]Enable or disable Cantrips individually
[/list]
[Heading][u][color=#ffff00][size=2]Translations [/size][/color][/u][/Heading]

The mod has been localised in TesVedit, translated in [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/29148/?]TesVTranslator[/url]; all of the Strings files are included in the archive. MCM is translatable as well.
Currently supported languages: English, Polish. Other languages use English as base. If you are expecting CTDs because of my mod and you are not
playing any of the translated languages, contact me. If you would like to translate the mod, contact me, so I can credit you and include your strings in my mod!

 [img width=67,height=45]https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/ae/Flag_of_the_United_Kingdom.svg/1200px-Flag_of_the_United_Kingdom.svg.png[/img] [img width=67,height=45]https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/1/12/Flag_of_Poland.svg/800px-Flag_of_Poland.svg.png[/img]

[heading][color=yellow][u]Installation[/u][/color][/heading]
[color=orange]Recommended:[/color] Download with NMM or MO (preferred) and activate.

For a manual installation, download and extract the contents of the archive to your Skyrim/Data folder.

[color=orange]If you are not starting a new game, install Spell Crafting for Skyrim, load your save game, once loaded save again immediately, and then reload the save to ensure proper initialization.[/color]

Be sure to back up your saves (as if you haven't been told that a hundred times).

[heading][color=yellow][u]Uninstall[/u][/color][/heading]
[color=orange]Recommended:[/color] Deactivate with NMM or MO

For a manual uninstall, delete:
[list]
[*]Skyrim\Data\_tck_SpellCrafting.esp
[*]Skyrim\Data\_tck_SpellCrafting.bsa
[*]SKSE\Plugins\GrimyTools.dll (provided other mods are not using it; dlls won't work from inside BSAs)
[/list]
** Once uninstalled, performing a clean save is highly recommended.

[heading][color=yellow][u]Updating[/u][/color][/heading]
Updating to 1.0.0 from 0.9.9 or previous "revised" versions doesn't require any special precautions. 

Updating to 0.9.6.1 (and later versions) from 0.9.5 (and older) is as far as I know, impossible if you were not using Dragonborn and Dawnguard. A clean save is required. Deactivate the mod, make a clean save, uninstall mod, reinstall new version, and then use the MCM to cheat all your cantrips back.

Updating to version 0.9.5 from any previous version will require deactivating the mod and creating a clean save. This will cause you to lose all of the custom spells you have already created and to lose all of the Cantrips you have learned. I'm sorry about this inconvenience, but it is the only way to clear out the old scripts. You will be able to use the MCM menu options to give yourself any Cantrips you may lose once version 0.9.5 has been activated. Any lost spells will have to be recreated.

Before you begin, be sure to make a save of your current game in case something goes horribly wrong -- backups are your friend.

If anyone has any problems with the update, please let me know.

[heading][color=yellow][u]Compatibility[/u][/color][/heading]
Has been cleaned with TES5Edit.

Has been tested with other custom spell mods with no conflicts found (by compatible I mean that the spells can be added to the spellcrafting system and compatibility issues in game without - most likely - needing a patch. Read more [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/articles/50548/?]here[/url], in 0.9.9 update ).

Compatible with Immersive College of Winterhold.

Compatible with Perkus Maximus and Skyrim Redone, though patches are needed.

Compatible with Ordinator (user-tested only). 

Compatible with Requiem (user-tested only). 

Potentially incompatible with other mods that uses out-dated or modified (and not renamed) UILIB_1 library or Grimy's Plugin.

[heading][color=yellow][u]What Is Not Supported[/u][/color][/heading]
[list]
[*]Spell Crafting for Skyrim currently does not support [s]concentration spells or spells that target locations. Creature Conjuration (which does target locations) has been included by not allowing Creature Conjuration effects to be combined with other effects.[/s]
[/list][list]
[*][s]Dual Casting of crafted spells is currently not supported. You can cast the same crafted spell from each hand at the same time, but no Dual Casting benefits are gained.[/s]
[*]As of version 0.9.7 both of the above issues have been fixed, though they still can be disabled via MCM. Engine (formerly Experimental) spells do not suffer any of those problems to begin with.
[/list]
[heading][color=yellow][u]Change History[/u][/color][/heading]
See the Nexus Changelog for full list of new changes. Check Article [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/articles/50548/?]Older updates[/url] to see older ones.

[heading][color=yellow][u]Future Plans[/u][/color][/heading]
As of version 0.9.6.1 please read the [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/articles/50401/?]Future Plans[/url] article to learn more.

I plan to continue developing and adding new magic effects and functionality.

[heading][color=yellow][u]Thanks and Credit[/u][/color][/heading]
Thanks go to:

[*][size=2]scrivener07 -- I would never have figured out the upper/lower case character bug for custom spell names without your hints.[/size]

[*][size=2]DavidJCobb, for helping me with translatable strings.[/size]
[size=2]
[/size][/list][color=yellow][u][heading]Our Other Mods[/u][/color][/heading]

[heading][color=yellow][u]Permissions[/u][/color][/heading]
Please do not upload this work to any other sites without my permission.

[heading][color=yellow][u]Comments And Feedback[/u][/color][/heading]
As always, comments, both positive and negative, are welcome.

Thanks!
author: TaiChiKid and Piotrmil

files.name: Spell Crafting for Skyrim 0.9.6.1
files.changelogHtml:
New UILIB_1 library from SkyUI,

Several problems related to magicka cost being calculated incorrectly and its usage during casting/sheathing spell have been fixed,

Melrin is now more competent: cantrips he's selling are now tied to your skill level, just like other vendors' spells,

MCM allows you to look up your progress on each cantrip,

Cantrips can now be learned by casting other modded spells, since the learning process is now based (largely) on keywords. Also, some spells can teach you more than one cantrip (see article "Updates" to learn more)

Conjuration summoning effects can now be linked, an option has been added to MCM

Dual -Casting is now working, though it has limitations - constant casting may not work due to Skyrim's engine flaws. An option has been added to MCM.

Spellcrafting station now has cookie jars, giving you sweets boosting your magical skills for a short time.
Now requires Dragonborn and Dawnguard

files.name: Spell Crafting for Skyrim 0.9.6.2
files.changelogHtml:
Spell tester: allows you to test the effects of your spells on a summonable puppet. Control its statistics, like health, weaknesses, health rate, or even its race.
While the Spell Tester is active, you are not learning any cantrips, and you only gain 0.05 experience of your magical and battle skills, preventing you from exploiting it as a experience generating punch bag.

Fire/Frost/Shock Rune have been added
Fortify Magicka has been added (under Fortification)

DLC1 - related archetypes have been added:
Sun Damage
Heal Undead
Conjure Gargoyle
Conjure Boneman/Mistman/Wrahman
Sun Cloak

Elemental menus shared a list with others and thus appeared incorrectly - fixed.

Creature Conjuration incorrectly addressed some of the creatures - fixed.

Fixed the Conjuration descriptions in cantrip books about them being impossible to combine.

Fixed notification in Conjure Skeleton Cantrip

Fixed Bound Weapon Menu bug, where Bow would appear twice

Fixed Bound Battle Axe Cantrip book typo

Fixed Reanimation spell menu problem (it showed a target menu unnecessarily)

Fixed the Dual-Casting perk, it was too powerful by accident.

Fixed typo in Fortify Health spells

Restore Health spells now also restores stamina with Respite perk

Changed the lighting settings a bit; now uses warmer Farmlight.

Added one new bookcase; cantrips from DLC1 will appear there as Player progresses through Dawnguard

Removed some semi-dirty edits associated with Conjuration spells (they are covered by the USKP)

Removed cob-webs in the chamber.

files.name: Spell Crafting for Skyrim 0.9.6.3
files.changelogHtml:
New Archetypes:

Cyclone
Whirlwind Cloak
Summon Ash Spawn
Summon Ash Guardian (Perm = heart stone version)
Summon Seeker
Ash Shell
Ash Rune

Added Extended Twin Souls perk

Fixed Fortify Magicka (35p/30s/self) magnitude

Sun Cloak will now appear as a buyable cantrip after finishing dawnguard if you are a vampire.

Fixed Restoration list

Fixed Runes Menu

Fixed typo in Paralysis Cantrip book

Fixed Spell Tester's Max Health/magicka/stamina calculation

Redid the cantrip learning script, which prevented some spells from ever getting recognised.

files.name: Spell Crafting for Skyrim 0.9.7 Experimental
files.changelogHtml:
Experimental version utilising Grimy's Plugin.

25 new spell slots, for experimental uses.

Fixed Melrin's cantrips being sold incorrectly

Fixed Dummy alteration spell's hand effect from weird red hands to typical alteration green

Fixed Cookie Jar's scripts.


Fixed the DLC2 cantrips not appearing in the Journal cantrip list

Added options in the journal for the experimental spells.

Added option to craft spells remotely, via the journal, if PC is the Archmage or are using debug mode.

files.name: Spell Crafting for Skyrim 0.9.7.1
files.changelogHtml:
Added "Tweak spell" option (experimental ones)

Removed some old debug leftover spells

Fixed scripted illusion menu looping (patch for perma)

Tweaked the "forget experimental spell" option

Tweaked the experimental menu, added extra details window

Included spell perk system

Fixed some Weaknesses' keywords

Weaknesses do not stack now

Sun damage Aimed Interval/Area Interval/Sun Cloak description

Cloaks now scale their damage properly using a script that uses deprecated Actor values of Fame and Infamy

files.name: Spell Crafting 0.9.7.2
files.changelogHtml:
Frost and Shock Damage Interval spell descriptions fixed
Tweak Spell debug message removed
Paralysis and Ethereality did not needed magnitude
Added Patches page to MCM
Fixed inactive DLC2 buttons in MCM
Added heal Undead self
Added option to change spell's name in Tweak menu
Fixed a problem with forgetting exp spell; if the new spell filling the same spot had more effects, the spell would still remember it until reload.
Become Ethereal lacked spell school (now it i alteration)
Melrin will now sell Spell-Crafting Journals, had you lost all of them, and in anticipation of SpellCrafting Campfire Addon
Added a failsafe if experimantal spell has too many effects (current limit is 31)

Updated perma patch to 0.03

Added SpellCrafting Campfire Addon

files.name: Spell Crafting Campfire addon - Portable Altar
files.fileName: Spell Crafting Campfire addon - Portable Altar-33598-0-01.7z

files.name: Spell Crafting for Skyrim 0.9.8
files.changelogHtml:
Added "Inspect Spell" power, along with a system to add third-party spells to the spell-crafting system.

Changed the nomenclature of spell types and magnitude/duration multipliers

Drain Health/Magicka/Stamina concentrated added

Drain Magicka/Stamina have blue/green effects now.

Detect Life cloak spell is now showing all types of friend/enemies correctly

Scripted spells (formerly "regular spells") now show magicka cost, and the hand visuals are changed to match first spell's.

Frenzy Rune added

Poison Rune Added

Perkus Maximus patch 0.04 released
Fortify Skill Cantrip has now a toggleable max magnitude cap
I've cleaned up nexus page, removing the older text updates. They are now in a separate article.

files.name: SpellCrafting for Skyrim 0.9.9
files.changelogHtml:
New, rewritten cantrip learning script - should be putting less stress on the game, and won't flood the papyrus logs. The new system has also an option to leatn cantrips automatically.
Heal/Heal Undead interval added, do not stacks with themselves
Restore Stamina added, in regular and over time variation
Shock Damage interval descriptions fixed
Healing Area spell fixed
Cloaks' magnitude no longer affects the damage, only area
Replaced the static books on shelves with fake activator containers
Removed more elements of scripts that were faulty and were spamming the papyrus logs
Changed naming conventions a bit more: Magnitude/Duration multiplier can now have changed names - for example in case of cloaks, Magnitude becomes "Area", and in case of influence spells "Level"
Added an option to bypass checks in Inspect Spell power
Inspect Spell power has an option to add inspected spell to compatibility list of any cantrips, eliminating any need of compatibility patches that would serve only that purpose.

files.name: SpelCrafting for Skyrim Perkus Maximus patch
files.fileName: SpelCrafting for Skyrim Perkus Maximus patch-33598-0-0-6.7z

files.name: SpelCrafting for Skyrim Perkus Maximus patch

files.name: SpellCrafting for Skyrim 1.0.0
files.changelogHtml:
ESPs are now open for translation, currently English and Polish available.

Fixed a bug where Inspect spell could be cast twice in a row

Learning step became a float that can range from 0.1 do 5.0

A message will now display once upon assigning a casting perk, to remind people that it may not correlate with the ones in SkyUI menus.

Added stamina cantrip to list of visible cantrips

typos

fix whirlwind cloak not being available

Books will now instantly appear in Melrin's chest

Standarised the removed barrels to being disabled instead of deleted, like in Immersive College of Winterhold, except for a bed for Melrin (one ITM)

Slow - fixed school and effects.

New archetype - Walls

New audio for Melrin's dialogue with Spellcrafting helper.

files.name: Spell Crafting - Portable Altar - Campfire Addon
files.fileName: Spell Crafting - Portable Altar - Campfire Addon-33598-0-0-2.7z

files.name: SpellCrafting for Skyrim 1.0.1
files.changelogHtml:
Added Walls and Restore Stamina cantrips to Journal, since they were not showing up

Translated Journal menus

Fixed one meaningless error spamming in papyrus log

Removed some troublesome navmeshes

Fixed the Inspect Spell power

Fixed the refreshing menu bug - it should work for all now, if you don't get the menu at all it probably means you have a script lag; try launching the game again.
